instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post or USB activity
threads.message: I have on the bench and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has Magsafe light, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.57V, CPU gets hot but no USB activity or Chime/Image. This unit did suffer a water spill and the noted areas of corrosion are In the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> area. I replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> but no change. I am getting <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> so I assume all rails are present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post or USB activity
threads.message:
If CPU gets hot, probably VCORE is present.
But do NOT assume; check if is there.
If present, try known good BIOS.

<CHIP>U7200</CHIP> is CPU VCORE power supply controller.
You can also try changing <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Post or USB activity
threads.message: Ok, i'll check that. Ithiought I checked a few days ago and founf that it has VCORE but I will double check.
